data.chText: 奋斗；努力；争取
data.enText: to try very hard to do sth when it is difficult or when there are a lot of problems

data.chText: 为独立而奋斗的国家
data.enText: a country struggling for independence

data.chText: 肖娜艰难地喘着气。
data.enText: Shona struggled for breath .

data.chText: 一个生活难以温饱的艺术家
data.enText: life as a struggling artist (= one who is very poor)

data.chText: 他们辛苦所得仅敷日用。
data.enText: They struggled just to pay their bills.

data.chText: 艰难地行进；吃力地进行
data.enText: to move somewhere or do sth with difficulty

data.chText: 我背着几个沉重的包吃力地爬上山去。
data.enText: I struggled up the hill with the heavy bags.

data.chText: 保罗挣扎着下了轮椅。
data.enText: Paul struggled out of his wheelchair.

data.chText: 斗争；抗争
data.enText: to fight against sb/sth in order to prevent a bad situation or result

data.chText: 他同癌症抗争了两年。
data.enText: He struggled against cancer for two years.

data.chText: 莉萨经过一番良心上的斗争，终于对警方说了。
data.enText: Lisa struggled with her conscience before talking to the police.

data.chText: 搏斗；扭打；挣扎脱身
data.enText: to fight sb or try to get away from them

data.chText: 本和杰克在草地上扭打起来。
data.enText: Ben and Jack struggled together on the grass.

data.chText: 我挣扎着，高声呼救。
data.enText: I struggled and screamed for help.

data.chText: 詹姆斯在同几个劫匪搏斗时嘴上挨了打。
data.enText: James was hit in the mouth as he struggled with the raiders.

data.chText: 她是如何设法逃脱的？
data.enText: How did she manage to struggle free ?

data.chText: 争夺；辩论
data.enText: to compete or argue with sb, especially in order to get sth

data.chText: 互相对立的领导人争夺权力
data.enText: rival leaders struggling for power
struggle along/on

data.chText: 在困难中坚持；勉力维持
data.enText: to continue despite problems

data.chText: 斗争；奋斗；努力
data.enText: a hard fight in which people try to obtain or achieve sth, especially sth that sb else does not want them to have

data.chText: 权力的争夺；领导权的斗争
data.enText: a power/leadership struggle

data.chText: 争取独立的斗争
data.enText: a struggle for independence

data.chText: 善恶之争
data.enText: the struggle between good and evil

data.chText: 为取得对公司的控制权，他正同对手进行一场激烈的斗争。
data.enText: He is engaged in a bitter struggle with his rival to get control of the company.

data.chText: 她不会轻易放弃自己的孩子。
data.enText: She will not give up her children without a struggle.

data.chText: 搏斗；扭打；（尤指）抢夺，挣扎脱身
data.enText: a physical fight between two people or groups of people, especially when one of them is trying to escape, or to get sth from the other

data.chText: 在凶杀现场没有搏斗痕迹。
data.enText: There were no signs of a struggle at the murder scene.

data.chText: 难事
data.enText: something that is difficult for you to do or achieve

data.chText: 要按时做好准备确非易事。
data.enText: It was a real struggle to be ready on time.

data.text: campaign ♦ battle ♦ struggle ♦ drive ♦ war ♦ fight

data.chText: 以上各词均指为达到某目的或为阻止某事而作出的努力。
data.enText: These are all words for an effort made to achieve or prevent sth.
campaign

data.chText: 指为社会、商业或政治目的而进行的一系列有计划的活动或运动：
data.enText: a series of planned activities that are intended to achieve a particular social, commercial or political aim

data.chText: 要求议会改革的运动
data.enText: the campaign for parliamentary reform

data.chText: 广告宣传活动
data.enText: an advertising campaign
battle

data.chText: 指个人或集体为赢得权力或控制权而进行的较量、争论或斗争：
data.enText: a competition or argument between people or groups of people trying to win power or control

data.chText: 她终于赢得了这场要求赔偿的法律斗争。
data.enText: She finally won the legal battle for compensation.

data.chText: 人与大自然永无休止的斗争
data.enText: the endless battle between man and nature
struggle

data.chText: 指个人或集体为赢得权力或控制权而进行的较量、争论或斗争：
data.enText: a competition or argument between people or groups of people trying to win power or control

data.chText: 为独立的斗争
data.enText: the struggle for independence

data.chText: 正邪之争
data.enText: the struggle between good and evil

data.chText: 用battle还是struggle？
在许多情况下，上述两词可替换使用，但struggle总是用于似乎绝对必要的斗争，如关乎生死、自由等；battle还可用于非绝对必要的斗争，如仅仅是想望或者为了获得胜利的满足感：
data.enText: In many cases you can use either word, but a struggle is always about things that seem absolutely necessary, such as life and death or freedom. A battle can also be about things that are not absolutely necessary, just desirable, or about the pleasure of winning.

data.chText: 正邪之争
data.enText: the battle/struggle between good and evil
a legal struggle for compensation
a struggle of wills/wits
battle or struggle?
drive

data.chText: 指团体为达到目的而作出的有组织的努力：
data.enText: an organized effort by a group of people to achieve sth

data.chText: 为提高效率而进行的运动
data.enText: the drive for greater efficiency

data.chText: 为减少能源消耗而发起的运动
data.enText: a drive to reduce energy consumption

data.chText: 用campaign还是drive？
campaign通常为发动别人参加的运动；drive可指让自己作出努力：
data.enText: A campaign is usually aimed at getting other people to do sth; a drive may be an attempt by people to get themselves to do sth.

data.chText: 从今天起，我们要展开厉行节约运动。
data.enText: From today, we're going on an economy drive (= we must spend less) .

data.chText: campaign可指比drive更大规模、更正式和更有组织的活动或运动。
data.enText: A campaign may be larger, more formal and more organized than a drive .
campaign or drive?
war

data.chText: 指为消灭或阻止有害事物而进行的长期斗争：
data.enText: [sing.] an effort over a long period of time to get rid of or stop sth bad

data.chText: 扑灭罪行的斗争
data.enText: the war against crime
fight

data.chText: 指为制止或防止坏事物或为达到好目的而进行的斗争，或指竞赛，尤指体育竞赛：
data.enText: [sing.] the work of trying to stop or prevent sth bad or achieve sth good; an act of competing, especially in a sport

data.chText: 工人赢得了阻止强制裁员的斗争。
data.enText: Workers won their fight to stop compulsory redundancies.

data.chText: 用war还是fight？
war用于制止人人摒弃的事物（如毒品和犯罪）而进行的斗争；fight可用于为自己伸张正义而进行的斗争。
data.enText: A war is about stopping things, like drugs and crime, that everyone agrees are bad. A fight can be about achieving justice for yourself.
war or fight?
a campaign/battle/struggle/drive/war/fight for/against sth
a(n) strong/intensive/determined/concerted campaign/drive
a one-man/one-woman/personal campaign/battle/struggle/war/fight
a bitter/fierce campaign/battle/struggle/drive/war/fight
to launch/mount/start/lead/be engaged in/carry on/keep up a campaign/battle/struggle/drive/war/fight
to conduct/organize/run/manage a campaign/drive/war/fight
to win/lose a battle/struggle/war/fight

data.text: fight ♦ clash ♦ brawl ♦ struggle ♦ scuffle ♦ tussle

data.chText: 以上各词均指搏斗、打斗、打架。
data.enText: These are all words for a situation in which people try to defeat each other using physical force.
fight

data.chText: 指搏斗、打斗、打架：
data.enText: a situation in which two or more people try to defeat each other using physical force

data.chText: 他在酒吧里和一个男人斗殴。
data.enText: He got into a fight with a man in the bar.
clash

data.chText: 新闻用语，指两群人之间短暂的打斗、打架、冲突：
data.enText: ( journalism ) a short fight between two groups of people

data.chText: 警方与示威者发生了冲突。
data.enText: Clashes broke out between police and demonstrators.
brawl

data.chText: 通常指一群人在公共场合喧闹、斗殴、闹事：
data.enText: a noisy and violent fight involving a group of people, usually in a public place

data.chText: 在酒吧里酒后闹事
data.enText: a drunken brawl in a bar
struggle

data.chText: 指搏斗、扭打，尤指抢夺、挣扎脱身：
data.enText: a fight between two people or groups of people, especially when one of them is trying to escape, or to get sth from the other

data.chText: 在谋杀现场没有搏斗痕迹。
data.enText: There were no signs of a struggle at the murder scene.
scuffle

data.chText: 指短暂而不太激烈的扭打、冲突：
data.enText: a short and not very violent fight or struggle

data.chText: 他和一名摄影记者发生了肢体冲撞。
data.enText: He was involved in a scuffle with a photographer.
tussle

data.chText: 尤指为争夺物品的短时间的扭打、争斗、争执：
data.enText: a short struggle, fight or argument, especially in order to get sth

data.chText: 他在争球时受了伤。
data.enText: He was injured during a tussle for the ball.
in a fight/brawl/struggle/scuffle/tussle
a fight/clash/brawl/struggle/scuffle/tussle over sth
to be in/get into/be involved in a fight/clash/brawl/struggle/scuffle/tussle
to start a fight/brawl/scuffle
a fight/clash/brawl/struggle/scuffle/tussle breaks out
a fight/clash/brawl/struggle/scuffle takes place/starts
a violent fight/clash/brawl/struggle/scuffle/tussle
a street fight/brawl

ex.chText: 这两个村子团结起来与共同的敌人战斗。
ex.enText: The two villages banded together to fight their common enemy.

ex.chText: 有两个男人在街上打架。
ex.enText: Two man are fighting with each other in the street.

ex.chText: 由于缺少食物，那一地区的大部分村民不得不与饥饿作斗争。
ex.enText: Most of the villagers in that area have to fight against hunger due to lack of food.
They are fighting for higher wages.

synonyms.bx: 指作战、打架斗殴，或指努力想做某事或得到某事物。

ex.chText: 那些勇敢的消防员正在与烈火搏斗。
ex.enText: Those brave firefighters are battling the flames.
The man had battled against cancer.

ex.chText: 工人们正在为提高福利待遇而斗争。
ex.enText: Workers are battling for better welfare.
The two armies battled all night.

synonyms.bx: 主要指为达到某一目的而与困难、危险等作斗争；也指参战或作战。

ex.chText: 各快递公司在努力应付高成本。
ex.enText: Express companies are struggling with high costs.

ex.chText: 警察赶到时他正与小偷厮打。
ex.enText: He was struggling with the thief when the police came.
We struggled for possession of the gun.

synonyms.bx: 指为实现某事而作出极大的努力，也指为脱身而与他人搏斗或为得到某物而与他人争抢。

ex.zh: 陷入斗争（或搏斗、挣扎）之中的

data.enText: struggle along/on

data.chText: 在困难中坚持；勉力维持
data.enText: to continue despite problems

trans: 勉力维持；在困境中坚持

example: the struggle to get through the crowd exhausted her

tr: an energetic attempt to achieve something
example: getting through the crowd was a real struggle
he fought a battle for recognition

tr: an open clash between two opposing groups (or individuals)
example: the harder the conflict the more glorious the triumph"--Thomas Pain
police tried to control the battle between the pro- and anti-abortion mobs
Militant groups are contending for control of the country

tr: to exert strenuous effort against opposition
example: he struggled to get free from the rope

tr: climb awkwardly, as if by scrambling
make a strenuous or labored effort
example: She struggled for years to survive without welfare

value.def: If you struggle to do something, you try hard to do it, even though other people or things may be making it difficult for you to succeed.

example.ex: They had to struggle against all kinds of adversity...
example.tran: 他们不得不同一切困境做斗争。

example.ex: Those who have lost their jobs struggle to pay their supermarket bills.
example.tran: 那些失业的人们想方设法以支付超市的账单。

value.def: A struggle is a long and difficult attempt to achieve something such as freedom or political rights.

example.ex: Life became a struggle for survival.
example.tran: 生活成了一场奋力求生的斗争。

example.ex: ...a young lad's struggle to support his poverty-stricken family...
example.tran: 年轻的小伙子为了支撑他贫困的家庭所作的努力

example.ex: He is currently locked in a power struggle with his Prime Minister.
example.tran: 他目前陷入了一场同总理的权力之争当中。

value.def: If you struggle when you are being held, you twist, kick, and move violently in order to get free.

example.ex: I struggled, but he was a tall man, well-built.
example.tran: 我使劲挣扎，但他又高又壮。

value.def: If two people struggle with each other, they fight.

example.ex: She screamed at him to 'stop it' as they struggled on the ground...
example.tran: 他们在地上扭打成一团，她向他尖叫着“别打了”。

example.ex: We were struggling for the gun when it went off!...
example.tran: 我们正在争夺那把枪，这时它突然走火了！

example.ex: There were signs that she struggled with her attacker.
example.tran: 现场有她和攻击者扭打过的痕迹。

example.ex: He died in a struggle with prison officers less than two months after coming to Britain.
example.tran: 来英国不到两个月，他就在一次与狱警的打斗中丧命了。

value.def: If you struggle to move yourself or to move a heavy object, you try to do it, but it is difficult.

example.ex: I could see the young boy struggling to free himself...
example.tran: 我看到小男孩正在奋力挣脱。

example.ex: I struggled with my bags, desperately looking for a porter.
example.tran: 我提着行李艰难地走着，迫切地寻找着搬运工。

value.def: If you struggle somewhere, you succeed in moving there, but only with great difficulty.

example.ex: The pilot struggled out of the wreck almost uninjured...
example.tran: 飞行员艰难地从失事的飞机中爬出来，几乎没有受伤。

example.ex: I struggled into a bathrobe and staggered down the stairs.
example.tran: 我挣扎着穿上浴衣，踉跄地下了楼。

value.def: If a person or organization is struggling, they are likely to fail in what they are doing, even though they might be trying very hard.

example.ex: The company is struggling to find buyers for its new product...
example.tran: 该公司正竭力为其新产品寻找买主。

example.ex: One in five young adults was struggling with everyday mathematics... 1/5
example.tran: 的年轻人做日常的数学计算都费劲。

example.ex: By the 1960s, many shipyards were struggling.
example.tran: 到 20 世纪 60 年代，许多造船厂都在勉强支撑。

value.def: An action or activity that is a struggle is very difficult to do.

example.ex: Losing weight was a terrible struggle.
example.tran: 减肥是一件非常艰难的事。

trans: 与…斗争；与…作斗争；和…斗争
(尤指马克思主义理论描述的)阶级斗争
勉力维持；在困境中坚持
